title: National Grid ESO trial with UKPN finds reactive power could unlock 1.5GW of capacity in south east
lead: ​Savings of up to £100 million could be made with the introduction of a national reactive power market according to a trial conducted by National Grid ESO and UK Power Networks (UKPN).
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Grid ESO: Sharing our progress towards zero carbon electricity ahead of COP26
lead: Ahead of COP26 in November Julian Leslie, head of Networks at National Grid ESO shares his thoughts on how electricity in Great Britain has decarbonised in recent times.
author: Julian Leslie

title: BP eyes IoT-enabled EV charging with US$7 million investment in IoTecha
lead: ​BP Ventures is to integrate internet of things (IoT) electric vehicle (EV) charging firm IoTecha’s products into its EV infrastructure following a US$7 million (£5 million) investment.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Net zero possible by 2050 for £14bn annually but ‘meaningful, urgent action’ needed
lead: ​The UK can achieve net zero by the middle of the century for just £14 billion more a year by leaning on domestic renewable energy.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Foresight embraces digitalisation of renewable assets with Sennen partnership
lead: ​Digitalisation of the Foresight Group’s full portfolio of sustainable infrastructure – including UK solar and wind assets – is well underway.
author: Alice Grundy

title: PODCAST: Managing power shortages and new solar technologies
lead: The latest episode of the Solar Media Podcast, sponsored by Honeywell, is now available to stream, as we take a look at how Texas and California are managing power shortages as the summer heat intensifies.
author: Current± Staff

title: How collaboration with energy firms can help overcome charging barriers for electric trucks
lead: ​Tevva is aiming to drive forward the electrification of trucks, with a new partnership recently signed with Vattenfall, but challenges surrounding charging infrastructure are still very much present.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Move environmental levies off electricity bills to boost heat pump uptake, government told
lead: ​Environmental levies should be moved off of electricity bills to make sure it's always cheaper to run a heat pump than a boiler according to business and civil society groups.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UKERC warns Brexit to have 'undeniably important impact' on net zero
lead: ​"There is much that still needs to be resolved” surrounding the UK’s climate and energy policies following leaving the European Union.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Indra partners Jumptech as it looks to scale up EV charger rollout
lead: ​Indra has announced a new partnership with electric vehicle (EV) software provider Jumptech to help it scale up the rollout of its charging solution.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SPEN and UKPN hail success of ‘world's first’ real-time fault level measurement device
lead: ​The “world’s first” real-time fault level measurement device can provide results that are accurate to 1%.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Habitat Energy on maximising revenue streams as Dynamic Containment fills up
lead: Following the Current± Briefings: The future of Dynamic Containment webinar, we take a look at when the tipping point will be for the post-fault service.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: E.ON urges government to 'step up' the pace of decarbonisation
lead: Without immediate action from the government to clarify policies and introduce stricter regulation more urgently, the UK will miss its 2050 net zero goal, utility E.ON has warned.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Origami raises £20.5m to drive next phase of growth
lead: Energy tech firm Origami has raised £20.5 million of new funding to drive its next phase of growth.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SPEN offers up £13m to create new network capacity in Glasgow
lead: SP Energy Networks is providing £13 million in funding to create additional capacity in areas of Glasgow it expects electricity demand to grow.
author: Alice Grundy

title: ENA launches Energy Data Request Tool to boost transparency in 'big step forward'
lead: ​The Energy Networks Association (ENA) is improving access to energy networks’ data with the launch of the Energy Data Request Tool.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Climate-related failure of the power system key risk as UK fails to keep pace with climate change
lead: ​The UK is not keeping pace with the impact of climate change, with the risk of climate-related failure of the power system growing.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Britain's power system on track for zero carbon periods by 2025, ESO says
lead: Britain's electricity system will be capable of being powered solely by zero carbon sources of power by 2025 for periods at a time, National Grid ESO has said.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Grid services support: Battery projects stepping up and supporting the grid
lead: Following May's grid event in Ireland, Bernice Doyle, head of Grid Services at Statkraft explores how batteries are helping balance the system, and the challenges they still face.
author: Bernice Doyle

title: End-to-end fleet EV charging service Fleet Fix launched
lead: ​A new fleet electrification service claiming to be the first automated service to supply, install and manage the entire electric vehicle (EV) charger process has launched.
author: Alice Grundy
